title: Understanding DMDD
text: Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder (DMDD) is a condition primarily diagnosed in children. It involves severe and recurrent temper outbursts that are out of proportion to the situation.

title: Symptoms of DMDD
text: Children with DMDD often experience chronic irritability and frequent episodes of extreme behavioral dyscontrol.

hintAnswer: children experience chronic, intense, angry outbursts
title: Identifying the Correct Answer
text: Which of the following best describes DMDD?
choices: behavioral condition in which the child has symptoms of being uncooperative, defiant, and may be hostile toward people in authority
children experience chronic, intense, angry outbursts
strategy for preventing a recurring problematic behavior by first identifying why a behavior keeps recurring and then devising a plan to prevent recurrences
